messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Babies sucking thumbs
messages.msgSnippet: I have a sonogram with Aidan sucking his :-) ... [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messages.messageBody:
I have a sonogram with Aidan sucking his :-)


At 5:01 PM -0500 12/12/02, starsuncloud@... wrote:
>In a message dated 12/12/02 1:45:41 PM Central Standard Time,
>Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
>
><< From what I understand, babies suck can and do their finger is the
>womb! >>
>
>Yep. I was actually born with my thumb in my mouth, or so the story goes.
>My mother was stressing out when there was no crying sound right after giving
>birth, and the doc was busy tying the cord, she asks what is going on and he
>says "Oh, I'm sorry, everything is fine, she's just sucking her thumb"
>
>
>Ren
>"Knowledge will not always take the place of simple observation."
> ~Arnold Lobel

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Babies sucking thumbs
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/12/02 1:45:41 PM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/12/02 1:45:41 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< From what I understand, babies suck can and do their finger is the
womb! >>

Yep. I was actually born with my thumb in my mouth, or so the story goes.
My mother was stressing out when there was no crying sound right after giving
birth, and the doc was busy tying the cord, she asks what is going on and he
says "Oh, I'm sorry, everything is fine, she's just sucking her thumb"


Ren
"Knowledge will not always take the place of simple observation."
~Arnold Lobel
Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
